attributes.title: In his Florida primary, Matt Gaetz is fighting over the future identity of the GOP
attributes.description: Gaetz is in a primary fight tied to ousted House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, the latest salvo in an ongoing war. Gaetz led that ouster. Now his district encapsulates a GOP intraparty clash that fuels dysfunction on the House floor and the campaign trail.

attributes.title: John Lansing, the steady CEO who led NPR through the pandemic's crises, dies at 67
attributes.description: Lansing tangled with titans, kept the network’s shows on the air even as its offices closed during the COVID-19 pandemic, and steered NPR through what he defined as an “existential” financial crisis.

attributes.title: How to say 'Kamala' — and why it makes a difference
attributes.description: As Vice President Harris has risen up in the political world, the name "Kamala" is getting more airtime. And on the campaign trail, Harris' name is often intentionally mispronounced by her opponent.

attributes.title: ‘Washington Post’ reviews star columnist Taylor Lorenz's 'war criminal' jab at Biden
attributes.description: The Washington Post is reviewing star tech columnist Taylor Lorenz's private chat in which she posted a photo of herself near President Biden — and the caption "war criminal."

attributes.title: 4 ex-law enforcement officers are charged in a $37 million extortion scheme
attributes.description: Prosecutors say the ex-law enforcement and military officers took part in a wild scheme, funded by a Chinese national, to trick a man into signing away his rights in a business worth millions.

attributes.title: Who or what did Trump call 'the greatest cutter' this week? Find out in the quiz
attributes.description: After the blissful news avalanches of campaign hijinks and the Olympics, we're back to the usual soup of science, retail and animals.

attributes.title: What you need to know about the child tax credit as both campaigns embrace it
attributes.description: A major expansion of the child tax credit during the height of the COVID pandemic temporarily slashed the child poverty rate in half. That is one reason why it has become a hot topic in the presidential race.

attributes.title: The Trump team responds after 'Republicans for Harris' call Trump 'unfit' to be president
attributes.description: At its first rally, "Republicans for Harris" encouraged fellow conservatives to vote for Democrats over former President Donald Trump. The Trump team responded, calling Harris "dangerously liberal."

attributes.title: Why 'the last Democrat standing' in Montana is skipping the DNC
attributes.description: Montana used to vote consistently purple, but now there's only one Democrat holding statewide office, three-term U.S. Sen. Jon Tester. He's not exactly embracing his party this election cycle.

image.caption: Sen. Jon Tester, D-Mont., is hoping his status as the only working farmer in the Senate will help him secure a fourth term in November.

attributes.title: Water treaty between Mexico and U.S. faces biggest test in 80 years
attributes.description: The water-sharing systems between Mexico and the U.S. are facing one of the biggest tests in their 80-year history after Mexico has fallen behind on billions of gallons of water deliveries.
